isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - DESCRIPTION

svcsubsecinfo.para: The contents of this service manual section focus on International-installed components and wiring and how those components function as part of the transmission electronic control system. For more detailed information regarding the Allison WT transmission and the Allison supplied components that are part of the WTEC III electronic control system, refer to the appropriate Allison service manuals.
The World Transmission (WT) is an electronically controlled transmission designed by Allison Transmission. The WT Electronic Controls system consists of the following components:

item.para: Shift Selector and MODE Selector Button
Engine, Turbine and Output Speed Sensors
Diagnostic Data Link (Part Of The International Cab/Platform Harness)
"CHECK TRANS LIGHT" Red Instrument Panel Light (Part of International Instrument Cluster)

svcproc.title: ELECTRONIC CONTROL UNIT (ECU)
svcproc.para: The Electronic Control Unit (ECU) is a microcomputer, which is the brain of the transmission control system ( Figure 1). The ECU contains Electronically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), which is programmed by Allison with a shift calibration that reflects the specific transmission assembly, the vehicle engine, and customer selected package of "Spare Input and Output" options available for controlling additional vehicle components.
The ECU communicates with the vehicle electrical system and International-installed transmission control components through the transmission harness and International installed relays.

item.para: Other components that are part of the Allison WT electronic control system ( Figure 2).

figure.caption: Electronic Control Unit (ECU) And Its Sensor And Actuator Interfacing

svcproc.para: The ECU sends information to the vehicle electrical system controlling back-up light operation, prevents the vehicle engine from starting in any gear other than neutral, and provides the input signal to drive the vehicle's electronic speedometer. The ECU also is in direct communication with the Antilock Brake System Electronic Control Module (ECM) so that when the antilock system senses a wheel lockup condition is about to occur and modulates the brake system, the Allison WT control system senses this and will disengage the transmission lockup clutch (and will disengage a retarder if installed).
